definition: round/lump/ball/to roll into a ball/to gather/regiment/group/society/classifier for a lump or a soft mass: wad (of paper), ball (of wool), cloud (of smoke)
to fan/to slap sb on the face
fan/sliding, hinged or detachable flat part of sth/classifier for doors, windows etc
kesi or k’o-ssu, Chinese silk tapestry woven in a pictorial design
court lady/palace maid/traditional painting of beautiful women
Suzhou embroidery, one of the four major traditional styles of Chinese embroidery (the other three being 湘繡|湘绣[Xiang1 xiu4], 粵繡|粤绣[Yue4 xiu4] and 蜀繡|蜀绣[Shu3 xiu4])

same as 斑竹[ban1 zhu2], mottled bamboo, since according to legend the spots on mottled bamboo are marks left by the tears shed by two of King Shun's 舜[Shun4] concubines (Ehuang 娥皇[E2 huanɡ2] and Nüying 女英[Nü3 yinɡ1], known as the Concubines of the Xiang 湘妃[Xiang1 Fei1]) upon learning of his death
pipa, Chinese lute, with 4 strings, a large pear-shaped body and a fretted fingerboard
a small table to accommodate an incense burner
variant of 緙絲|缂丝[ke4 si1]
